Summary: Publish canonical Trust OS v1 contract document
Description: Freeze a single v1 contract document defining hard guarantees explicit non-goals fail-closed semantics and deterministic evidence requirements.
Acceptance Criteria: Contract doc is published in docs with in-scope and out-of-scope boundaries; fail-closed guarantees are explicit; release checklist references the contract as a required artifact.

Summary: Add numeric SLO thresholds for Trust OS runtime and onboarding
Description: Define and enforce numeric thresholds for policy latency deterministic hash stability dispute SLA timing and time-to-first-verified-receipt.
Acceptance Criteria: SLO thresholds are documented and measured; CI gates fail when threshold checks regress; weekly reports include baseline and delta per SLO.

Summary: Enforce authority boundary contract for signer and emergency controls
Description: Codify who can sign policy who can rotate or revoke keys and who can trigger pause quarantine kill controls with rollback requirements.
Acceptance Criteria: Authority model is documented and tested; unauthorized signer or control actions fail with stable codes; rollback path is verified in automated test flow.

Summary: Require adapter invariant conformance for new rail lanes
Description: Block adapter promotion unless shared trust-kernel invariants pass for policy enforcement replay protection receipt determinism and reversal idempotency.
Acceptance Criteria: Adapter conformance suite runs in CI for each lane; merge and release fail on invariant regression; report artifact includes invariant IDs and failed surfaces.

Summary: Add no-bypass negative matrix for MCP and bridge paths
Description: Add explicit deny or challenge bypass attempts across stdio MCP HTTP MCP bridge and paid tool bridges to prove policy runtime cannot be skipped.
Acceptance Criteria: Negative matrix test suite covers stdio and HTTP paths; all bypass attempts fail deterministically with stable reason codes; suite is included in required release gates.

Summary: Add deterministic repeat-run export soak check
Description: Stress deterministic export paths with repeated runs and assert stable canonical hashes for equivalent inputs.
Acceptance Criteria: Repeated export runs for fixed fixtures produce identical canonical hashes; drift is surfaced with artifact diffs; soak check is release-blocking.
